p: As seen from the Table 2, on the southern Chinese coast, whether the S F or S T , Elevation was by far the most important for the distribution of S. alterniflora with the values being 0.8561 and 0.9294, respectively, which were much greater than those of the second most important Bio02 with S F and S T being only 0.0658 and 0.1423, respectively. The S F of Bio14, Bio19, Tgravel, Tph, Tsand, and Tclass were 0, while the S T of them became non‐zero values. Moreover, the sum of S F is 0.9289 and the sum of S T was 1.3310. It indicated that there were still interactions among variables, but much weaker than that on the northern Chinese coast. Although the S F and S T of Elevation were much higher than Bio02, the difference was as great as that of Bio02, which indicated that both of them had distinguished interactions, especially for Bio02.
